title: Video technology could be introduced into English football next season as early as the Community Shield
text:
Sport Video technology could be introduced into English football next season as early as the Community Shield The issue of video replays was thrown back into the spotlight after Manolo Gabbiadini's wrongly given offside goal in the League Cup final Share Video Assistant Referees could be introduced into English football next season (Photo: AFP/Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Video technology could be introduced to English football by next season's Charity Shield. 
After the success of goal-line technology the game's lawmakers are considering bringing on Video Assistant Referees (VAR) to assist on controversial decisions. 
The Daily Telegraph reports that the International Football Association Board will discuss trialling video reviews in games organised by the Football Association at their AGM at Wembley on Friday. 
With the IFAB ready to sanction use of VARs at next year's World Cup, officials in England are keen to conduct trials before the tournament kicks off. 
And the issue of VARs was thrown back into the spotlight during Sunday's League Cup final at Wembley where Southampton's Manolo Gabbiadini wrongly had a goal ruled out for offside . Manolo Gabbiadini has a goal wrongly ruled out for offside at the League Cup Final (Photo: Reuters) Video Assistant Referees would have correctly identified Gabbiadini's goal should have stood (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Video technology has already been used abroad to some degrees of success. it was first used in competitive football in December during the World Club Cup semi-final clash between Kashima Antlers and Atletico Nacional. Hungarian official Viktor Kassai awarded a penalty to the Japanese side after consulting using technology. 
The next day it was consulted again for a Cristiano Ronaldo goal that looked offside. 
And just last month David Villa was sent off for New York City after being caught on camera punching Houston Dynamo's AJ DeLaGarza. The referee had booked Villa but after consulting the replays, sent the former Barcelona man off. General view of a part of a video refereeing system before the World Club Cup Final (Photo: Reuters) 
Secret trials had taken place during Premier League games last season but clubs pushed back on advancements, preferring to see how trials played out in other countries first. 
Former Premier League referee David Elleray, who became IFAB technical director after hanging up his whistle, said yesterday: “We want to look at can we enhance the role and the responsibility of the captain to take some degree of responsibility for the behaviour of his or her players. 
“We want to look at time-wasting, we want to look at certain areas where we can make the game fairer and where match officials are respected and understood. A referee looks at the broadcast of the match between Ajax and Willem II (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
“The captain should be more than somebody who has a piece of material on their arm and attends the toss at the start of the game. 
“Can we say, for a major incident, [only] the captain may be able to talk to the referee? If that stops six players from each team going to talk the referee, that will enhance respect and improve respect for the game.” poll loading Is it time for video technology in football? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
